summaries.body: Japan's Parliament passed legislation lowering the voting age to 18, from 20.

posts.footer: A Times correspondent in Hong Kong, where protesters gathered as the Legislative Council prepared to debate a Beijing-approved plan for electing the city's leader, via Twitter

summaries.body: Gathering of the pro-Beijing clans outside Legco in Hong Kong. THERE CAN BE ONLY ONE http://t.co/4pP2MbavEk
Amnesty International accused Myanmar of threatening, harassing and imprisoning journalists as national elections approach this year.

posts.footer: A statement from Neil Young's team, which added that the Canadian musician supports Senator Bernie Sanders for president, via The New York Times

summaries.body: Donald Trump was not authorized to use ‘Rockin’ in the Free World’ in his presidential candidacy announcement.

posts.footer: The Australian Broadcasting Corporation | The Associated Press

summaries.body: Australia signed a free trade agreement with China, as its trade minister warned that the United States had little time to salvage a broader Asia-Pacific accord.
Vietnam accused China of intercepting two Vietnamese fishing boats and using water cannon against a third in disputed South China Sea waters.
Canada's top military officer apologized for saying that sexual harassment in the military was due in part to how offenders are "biologically wired."
Joe Paterno, the Penn State coach who was fired amid a child sex abuse scandal at the university, was posthumously elected to the Pennsylvania Sports Hall of Fame.
The U.S. plans to provide $5 million to help support a regional military force fighting Boko Haram, the Islamist militant group in Nigeria, a State Department official said.
Gov. Jerry Brown and California lawmakers announced a budget deal that extends public health care coverage to immigrant children who are in the country illegally.
The world's largest underground aquifers, a source of fresh water, are being depleted at alarming rates, according to new NASA satellite data.
A college student in Queens was charged with conspiring to support the Islamic State after an investigation found he planned to attack New York City landmarks.
A decline in egg production by 341 million dozen this year is expected to mean a wholesale price of $1.60 to $1.66 for a dozen New York large eggs, a record high.

posts.footer: A Times columnist, via Twitter. The U.S. plays Nigeria at 8 p.m. Eastern in the Women's World Cup.

summaries.body: Alex Morgan starts her 1st game at this World Cup. Is she 90-minutes ready? Let's see in a few. Abby Wambach, a sub last game, is a starter.
While it prevailed in its legal argument, Maurice R. Greenberg's firm still thinks the government owes money to A.I.G. shareholders.
U.S. officials proposed declaring the eastern cougar to be extinct. Officials said they most likely have been for at least 70 years but were listed as endangered in 1973.
President Mahmoud Abbas of the Palestinian Authority said the national unity government he formed with Hamas last year would dissolve. He did not give a timetable.
21st Century Fox announced that Rupert Murdoch's two sons would assume new leadership roles, continuing plans to keep control of the company in the family.
The Foo Fighters have canceled the remainder of their European tour after Dave Grohl, the band's frontman, fell and broke his leg at a show on June 12 in Sweden.
Mayor Pete Buttigieg of South Bend, Ind., came out as gay Tuesday, writing in a newspaper that it took him years to accept that his sexuality is just "part of who I am."

display_asset.credit: Jason Minto/The Wilmington News-Journal, via The A.P.

summaries.body: Molly Shattuck, a former Baltimore Ravens cheerleader, pleaded guilty to fourth-degree rape. She was accused of having a relationship with a 15-year-old boy.
Among its announcements at the E3 conference, Nintendo said Super Mario Maker, which allows gamers to craft their own Super Mario levels, will arrive on Sept. 11.
BBC said Chris Evans would be the new "Top Gear" host, taking over for Jeremy Clarkson on the popular car show.
The HBO show “Game of Thrones” set a series record for total viewers with its season finale Sunday night with 8.1 million viewers, according to Nielsen.
Twitter’s departing chief executive officer, Dick Costolo, said he is confident about its current strategy and team, but his replacement should have the leeway to make changes.
Boston 2024, the private group organizing the city’s bid to host the 2024 Summer Olympics, is offering a new plan that spreads the events across Massachusetts.

display_asset.credit: Rachel Denny Clow/Corpus Christi Caller-TImes, via Associated Press

summaries.body: A tropical storm has started to make landfall along the Texas coast, bringing torrential rain and possible flooding as it moves north. It is forecast to reach Dallas on Wednesday.
Omar Gonzalez, an Army veteran from Texas, was sentenced to 17 months in prison for jumping the White House fence and entering the East Room in September.
United Airlines said it would move out of Kennedy International Airport this year and shift all of its flights to Los Angeles and San Francisco to its hub in Newark.
South Korea said it now has 154 Middle East respiratory syndrome cases, the largest outbreak outside of Saudi Arabia. Above, workers fumigate a theater.
Donald Trump announced that he is running for president: "We are going to make our country great again."
At least 17 people were killed and 70 were injured when a passenger train hit a truck and derailed at an unmarked crossing south of Tunisia's capital, officials said.
More than 23,000 new refugees fleeing recent fighting in northern Syria have crossed into Turkey, the United Nations refugee agency said, quoting Turkish authorities.
Thousands of villagers have evacuated but others are refusing to leave homes near Mount Sinabung in Indonesia, even as avalanches of hot ash barreled down its slopes.
The Food and Drug Administration said it would require food companies to phase out the use of artificial trans fats almost entirely, saying they are a public health concern.
Permits to build houses in the United States rose 11.8 percent in May to a 1.28 million annualized pace, the highest since August 2007, government figures showed.
Fitbit, the maker of wearable health-tracking devices, raised the range for the expected pricing of its initial public offering to $17 to $19 a share.
An 18-year-old German man was sentenced to three years in detention for hitting a woman, Tugce Albayrak, who fell and later died. She had tried to stop him harassing two girls.

posts.footer: A CNN media reporter on the former N.A.A.C.P. leader being interviewed by Matt Lauer on “Today."

summaries.body: Catchiest quote in @MLauer's Rachel Dolezal interview so far, about how her complexion's changed: "I... certainly don't stay out of the sun"
Prince Alwaleed bin Talal, a Saudi billionaire, said he settled a libel suit against the Forbes magazine group. He claimed the magazine underestimated his fortune.

display_asset.caption: Al Haj Murad Ebrahim, the head of the Moro Islamic Liberation Front, inspecting a rocket launcher at the handover in Sultan Kudarat, Philippines, on Tuesday. President Benigno S. Aquino III, far left, said: “Our brothers are voluntarily laying down their arms.”

summaries.body: Islamic militants in the southern Philippines turned over dozens of weapons as part of a tentative peace deal. A final agreement is facing resistance from lawmakers.
Michelle Obama, left, and her daughters are in Britain for a two-day trip to promote her charity work. She is scheduled to meet Prince Harry and have tea with the prime minister.
Bahrain has sentenced an opposition leader, Sheikh Ali Salman, to four years in prison on charges related to incitement against the ruling system, his party said.
A British referendum on E.U. membership will not be held on May 5, 2016, the same day as votes in Scotland and Wales, a victory for those who want to leave the bloc.
The far-right National Front in France said on Monday it had enough support to form a group in the European Parliament, a move that would increase its influence.

display_asset.caption: Banca Monte dei Paschi was founded in 1472. It has survived plagues, panics and wars, though perhaps not the financial hubris that led to its bailout.
display_asset.credit: Gianni Cipriano for The New York Times

summaries.body: Monte dei Paschi, the world’s oldest bank, was the center of life in Siena, Italy, for centuries. So when it nearly collapsed, the city was left scrambling to fill the void.
Bangladesh's highest court upheld the death sentence given to an Islamist politician accused of atrocities during the country's war of independence in 1971.

posts.footer: H.R. Nagendra, a yoga consultant to Prime Minister Narendra Modi, describing the Indian leader's practice, via The New York Times

summaries.body: From one place to another place he will travel. During the travel, say half an hour, an hour — then he will relax, then he will remember the inner silence, the inner relaxation, the inner blissful awareness, and do the work.

posts.footer: A Times correspondent on reports that the leader of Al Qadea's Yemen affiliate was killed in an American drone strike, via Twitter

summaries.body: If Al Qaeda ideologue Abu Qatada is tweeting condolences for Wahashi's death, seems likely death is more than rumor https://t.co/uY6zHFmNW4
Israel released an animated video mocking Western coverage of the Gaza conflict last year, part of its effort to undermine potential criticism in a United Nations report.
China said it was nearly finished with land reclamation work in the South China Sea, calling the contentious island-building project "lawful, reasonable and justified."
An Ai Weiwei retrospective at the Royal Academy of Arts in London will feature 100 tons of rebar that was twisted in a devastating Chinese earthquake and straightened by hand.
South Korea reported three more deaths from Middle East respiratory syndrome, bringing the death toll from the outbreak there to 19.
A wildfire that began raging north of Anchorage on Sunday has grown in size, leading to the evacuation of up to 1,700 structures and the rescue of 500 dogs in sled-dog country.
Prince and Stevie Wonder entertained about 500 White House guests Saturday, but officials won't say much on the private party. Some attendees tweeted details, though.

display_asset.caption: An 18-inch-thick layer of concrete will raise the surface of Runway 4L-22R at Kennedy Airport a foot higher than its predecessor. It will also be widened and extended.
display_asset.credit: Chang W. Lee/The New York Times

summaries.body: Officials said if strong winds blow at Kennedy International Airport this summer, its four main runways could be reduced to one, potentially causing long delays.
After a misprint in test booklets, the College Board said it would not score two sections of the SAT and would waive fees for students who want to take it again.

display_asset.credit: Thomas Pitera/American Kennel Club, via Associated Press

summaries.body: The American Kennel Club said it will add to its roster three breeds, including a French sheep herder, a small Californian shepherd and an Italian truffle-sniffer, above.
Nepal reopened several heritage sites to the public on Monday even as the United Nations warned that the buildings were not entirely safe after an April 25 earthquake.
California must return $331 million that it took from a fund designated to help troubled homeowners but instead used to plug holes in the state's budget, a court ruled.
Legalizing medical marijuana has not led to an increase in the number of adolescents using it, according to new research that surveyed about a million teenagers.

posts.footer: The Associated Press | The New York Times

summaries.body: Blaze Starr, an exotic dancer who gained notoriety after having an affair with a 1950s-era Louisiana governor, died on Monday. She was 83.

display_asset.caption: A moon jellyfish. As juveniles, the species can realign itself to symmetry when it loses a tentacle.

summaries.body: A new study found that when a young moon jellyfish loses tentacles, it reorganizes its limbs to maintain symmetry — an important function for swimming and feeding.
Some food companies have shifted away from using BPA, a controversial chemical, in their cans, but advocates say there is a lack of information about alternatives.

display_asset.caption: The last time more than 20 million people watched the N.B.A. finals, Michael Jordan led the Bulls past Shandon Anderson and the Utah Jazz.

summaries.body: The N.B.A. finals haven't attracted 20 million viewers since Michael Jordan led the Chicago Bulls past the Utah Jazz in 1998, but Golden State and Cleveland are close.
LastPass, a password manager, said its network was breached and that hackers made off with personal information, but said most users were protected.
At the E3 video game conference, Microsoft said Xbox One owners would be able to play many games created for the previous console, the Xbox 360.
Mayor Stephanie Rawlings-Blake of Baltimore said she would deny post-riot recovery loans to some liquor stores damaged in the Freddie Gray protests.

display_asset.caption: Eric Idle and John Cleese perform on the opening night of "Monty Python Live (Mostly)" in 2014 in London.

summaries.body: Eric Idle and John Cleese, two of the founding members of Monty Python, will go on a live tour in the fall. The comedians have not appeared as a duo before.
A 10-year-old girl who lost consciousness after riding a roller coaster in California died on Saturday, officials said on Monday. A cause of death has not been determined.
Officials readied along Mexico's southwestern coast as Hurricane Carlos swirled just offshore, bringing high waves and strong winds. Above, preparations in Cancun.
The San Diego Padres fired their manager, Bud Black, after starting the season 32-33. Dave Roberts will serve as interim manager.
Cities and counties in California may require developers to include affordable housing as a condition of a building permit, the state's Supreme Court ruled.

display_asset.credit: ILM/Universal Pictures/Amblin Entertainment, via Associated Press

summaries.body: The Universal dinosaur thriller “Jurassic World” now holds the record for the biggest weekend opening in movie history, pulling in $524.1 million at the box office worldwide.
Two youths who each had an arm amputated after separate shark attacks off the North Carolina coast on Sunday were in waist-deep water when they were bitten, officials said.
SpaceX, Elon Musk's rocket launch company, has announced a competition to design passenger vehicles for the Hyperloop, a proposed high-speed ground transport system.

display_asset.caption: Video captured a fire on the roof of the 19th century Basilica of Saint Donatian on Monday in the western French city of Nantes.
display_asset.title: Fire Engulfs Historic French Cathedral

summaries.body: The rare sight of a Gothic cathedral ablaze was caught on video Monday as a fire destroyed most of the roof of the 19th century Saint Donatien Basilica in Nantes, France.

posts.footer: The Seattle Times | The Associated Press

summaries.body: A Shell oil rig is on its way to Alaska after weeks of protests in Washington State. The U.S. Coast Guard said on Monday it detained activists in kayaks who tried to block it.
Nepal reopened hundreds of damaged monuments at heritage sites, trying to encourage tourism after two earthquakes killed about 8,800 people.
Suicide bombers struck two police buildings in the capital of Chad, killing about two dozen people. The extremist group Boko Haram was to blame for the attack, ministers said.
Two of the largest homebuilders in the U.S. have agreed to merge, creating a company with a market value of about $5.2 billion that will own or control 74,000 home sites.

posts.footer: Sigmar Gabriel, the leader of Germany's center-left Social Democratic party, on negotiations with Greece's leftist government to avoid default.

summaries.body: We will not let German workers and their families pay for the exaggerated election promises of a partly Communist government.
World leaders are condemning millions of refugees to an unbearable existence and thousands to death by failing to provide basic humanitarian protection, a report said.
Saudi Arabia is opening its stock market to foreigners for the first time on Monday. Foreigners will be able to own as much as 49 percent of a single stock.

display_asset.credit: Cindy Yamanaka/Orange County Register, via A.P.

summaries.body: Minicrabs, which look like tiny lobsters or crawfish, washed up by the thousands on Orange County, Calif., beaches after apparently working their way up the coast.
If you've ever had an airline lose your baggage while flying in the United States and wondered where it ended up, there's a good chance that it was Alabama.

posts.footer: Boris Johnson, the mayor of London, in defense of the Nobel laureate who complained about the "trouble with girls" in the laboratory, via The Telegraph

summaries.body: Sir Tim Hunt was doing what he has done all his life — pointing out a natural phenomenon he had observed.
A teenager from Yorkshire detonated a vehicle with explosives while fighting for the Islamic State in Iraq, reportedly making him Britain’s youngest suicide bomber.
Ahead of a United Nations report, Israel’s Foreign Ministry issued a paper on Sunday defending its conduct in last summer's war in the Gaza Strip.
A North Korean soldier defected to South Korea on Monday, walking across the southern half of the Demilitarized Zone that separates the rival countries.
Nearly two months after the devastating earthquake in Nepal, the country's heritage sites are set to reopen to the public, despite safety concerns raised by Unesco.

posts.footer: The most recent fatality brings the death toll to 16, according to the South Korean Health Ministry, via Twitter

summaries.body: MERS cases in South Korea rise to 150 with five more, one death http://t.co/kIw8P77IyU

posts.footer: Luis Garcia, a University of Southern California student who participated in a poll on sexual consent, via The Washington Post

summaries.body: It’s more like a physical affirmation. That’s hard to judge when either party might be intoxicated or impaired. It does become super hard to explicitly define what should be said and what should be done.
A teenage girl lost part of her arm and a teenage boy was severely injured in separate shark attacks in the waters off Oak Island, N.C., on Sunday.

display_asset.caption: One of dozens of animals to have escaped amid flooding in the main zoo in Tbilisi, Georgia, a hippopotamus was coaxed away from dangerous waters on Sunday.

summaries.body: Dozens of animals are on the loose in the capital city of Georgia, after heavy rains destroyed the enclosures of Tbilisi’s main zoo. At least 12 people died in the floods.
Dave Grohl, the Foo Fighters frontman, fell off a stage in Sweden and said he thought he broke his leg, but he returned to continue the concert. Above, before the fall.
The U.S. State Department said that there were technical problems with its overseas passport and visa systems but that they would be "fully operational again soon."
The singer and songwriter Van Morrison was knighted by Queen Elizabeth II for his services to music and tourism in Northern Ireland, where he was born.
At least 400 million people lack access to essential health services, the World Health Organization and World Bank said in a report they described as a wake-up call.
Flights to the Galápagos Islands were canceled Friday as residents protested legislation that would get rid of wage subsidies for public and private workers.
